Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed black with dot frieze at lip in added white, above frieze of white lotus buds; exterior: black bands around rim, reserved below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU38), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios. The sample number is written in ink 'NAU 38' on break. For parallels regarding the decoration on the exterior, see British Museum 1924,1201.592 and 1924,1201.582. For parallels regarding the interior decoration, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.141.46.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 306, no. 1224, pl. 159)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 38)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2021) (phase 2)
